H0.text: where is the latin language from. Ancient Greece

H1.text: where is the latin language from. The Mediterranean Region

H2.text: where is the latin language from. The Roman Empire

H3.text: where is the latin language from. Italic languages

A4.text: Latin was originally spoken by the Latins in Latium (now known as Lazio), the lower Tiber area around Rome, Italy.

A5.text: Latin (lingua Latina or Latinum) is a classical language belonging to the Italic branch of the Indo-European languages.

A6.text: Latin was the official language of ancient Rome

A7.text: The Italic languages form a branch of the Indo-European language family, whose earliest known members were spoken on the Italian Peninsula in the first millennium BC
